com.inrix.sdk.utils

Class StringUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.inrix.sdk.utils.StringUtils

  • public final class StringUtils
extends Object
    Contains useful static methods for manipulating strings.

      • isValidEmail

        public static boolean isValidEmail(String text)
        Returns whether a string is a valid email address.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to check.
        Returns:
        true if it's a valid email address; otherwise, false.

      • trimCharacters

                    char[] characters)
        Trim the supplied characters from the start and end of the input text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be trimmed.
        characters - The characters to remove.
        Returns:
        The trimmed input text.

      • trimCharacters

        public static String trimCharacters(String text,
                    char[] characters,
                    boolean trimWhiteSpace)
        Trim the supplied characters from the start and end of the input text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be trimmed.
        characters - The characters to remove.
        trimWhiteSpace - Trim white space in addition to the supplied characters. Similar to calling String.trim()
        Returns:
        The trimmed input text.

      • trimCharacters

                    Set<Character> characters)
        Trim the supplied characters from the start and end of the input text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be trimmed.
        characters - The characters to remove.
        Returns:
        The trimmed input text.

      • trimCharacters

        public static String trimCharacters(String text,
                    Set<Character> characters,
                    boolean trimWhiteSpace)
        Trim the supplied characters from the start and end of the input text.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be trimmed.
        characters - The characters to remove.
        trimWhiteSpace - Trim white space in addition to the supplied characters. Similar to calling String.trim()
        Returns:
        The trimmed input text.

      • truncate

        public static String truncate(String text,
              int newLength)
        Truncates the supplied characters to the given maximum length.
        Parameters:
        text - the supplied text.
        newLength - the new length. If string is shorter than the new length, the original string will be returned.
        Returns:
        the truncated string.
